radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Trace bilateral pleural effusions, four indeterminate lesions in the liver, nonobstructive calculus in the lower pole of the left kidney, subcentimeter hypodensities in both kidneys, trace free fluid in the pelvis, diffuse atherosclerotic calcifications in the aorta and its visualized branches, colonic diverticula, and degenerative changes of the bony skeleton.
Diffuse abnormal meningeal enhancement most notable in the cerebellum, with associated edema in the cerebellar hemispheres.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Increase in effacement involving the fourth ventricle and increase in the size of the lateral and third ventricles, suggestive of early obstructive hydrocephalus compared to the previous MRI study.
